interface.name: org.freedesktop.NetworkManager.NetNsInstance
interface.tp:docstring: The Settings interface allows clients to view and administrate a specific instance of network namespace controlled by NetworkManager.

method.name: GetDevices
method.tp:docstring: Get the list of realized network devices in the network namespace.

arg.name: devices
arg.tp:docstring: List of object paths of network devices present in the network namespace. This list does not include device placeholders (see GetAllDevices()).

method.name: GetAllDevices
method.tp:docstring: Get the list of all network devices in the network namespace.

arg.name: devices
arg.tp:docstring: List of object paths of network devices and device placeholders (eg, devices that do not yet exist but which can be automatically created by NetworkManager if one of their AvailableConnections was activated) in a given network namespace.

property.name: Name
property.tp:docstring: Name of the network namespace, as created in directory /var/run/netns.

property.name: Devices
property.tp:docstring: The list of realized network devices in the network namespace. Realized devices are those which have backing resources (eg from the kernel or a management daemon like ModemManager, teamd, etc).

property.name: AllDevices
property.tp:docstring: The list of both realized and un-realized network devices in the network namespace. Un-realized devices are software devices which do not yet have backing resources, but for which backing resources can be created if the device is activated.
